finance.a: About 30 active users: 6 in sales, 4 in accounting, 3 managers, 14 on the factory floor, 3 warehouse staff.
finance.q: Which countries do you operate in financially? (This affects tax rules and legal invoice formats)

finance.a: We use a basic CRM spreadsheet for leads. Win rate is around 35%. Average deal size is €18,000.
finance.q: What tax rates do you charge? Does it vary by product type or customer location?

finance.a: Standard 30-day payment terms. We accept bank transfer and occasionally credit card for smaller orders.
finance.q: What are your payment terms? (Net 30, Due on receipt, installments, etc.)

finance.a: Two warehouses (Ghent and Antwerp). Tracked in Excel. Monthly manual counts. FIFO costing. Raw material lead time is 2-5 weeks from European suppliers.
finance.q: How do you currently track what's been paid vs. what's outstanding?

finance.a: Currently no reorder rules — we run out of stock roughly 4 times per year which causes production delays.
finance.q: Do you need separate reporting by department, project, or business unit?

hr.a: Our main pain points are: inventory tracking across two warehouses is done in Excel, production scheduling is manual, purchase orders are emailed manually to suppliers, and our accounting team spends 2 days per month reconciling spreadsheets. We also have no CRM — leads are tracked in a shared inbox.
hr.q: What's your company structure? Departments, teams, reporting lines?

hr.a: A customer sends an RFQ, our sales team creates a quotation in Word, once confirmed they email manufacturing. Manufacturing creates a production order based on a bill of materials, we source raw materials from 6 main suppliers, produce the parts, do quality inspection, then ship via DHL freight. Invoicing is done on delivery. Payment terms are net-30.
hr.q: How do employees request time off? What types of leave do you offer?

hr.a: About 30 active users: 6 in sales, 4 in accounting, 3 managers, 14 on the factory floor, 3 warehouse staff.
hr.q: Do you track attendance? How do people clock in/out?

hr.a: We use a basic CRM spreadsheet for leads. Win rate is around 35%. Average deal size is €18,000.
hr.q: Do employees submit expenses for reimbursement?

inventory.a: We can configure that during the implementation phase.
inventory.q: Describe your warehouse setup: How many locations? Do you have zones, aisles, shelves, bins?

inventory.a: No strong preference, we are open to best practice recommendations.
inventory.q: Do any of your products need serial numbers or batch/lot tracking? (e.g., for recalls, expiration, warranties)

inventory.a: We are a manufacturing company called BelgiumParts NV, making precision metal components for the automotive industry. We have 95 employees across two sites in Ghent and Antwerp.
inventory.q: How do you know when to reorder? Do you have minimum stock levels set up?

inventory.a: Our main pain points are: inventory tracking across two warehouses is done in Excel, production scheduling is manual, purchase orders are emailed manually to suppliers, and our accounting team spends 2 days per month reconciling spreadsheets. We also have no CRM — leads are tracked in a shared inbox.
inventory.q: When an order comes in, how do your warehouse staff know what to pick and ship?

inventory.a: A customer sends an RFQ, our sales team creates a quotation in Word, once confirmed they email manufacturing. Manufacturing creates a production order based on a bill of materials, we source raw materials from 6 main suppliers, produce the parts, do quality inspection, then ship via DHL freight. Invoicing is done on delivery. Payment terms are net-30.
inventory.q: Do you use barcode scanners? Or plan to?

manufacturing.a: 80 employees on payroll, 15 contractors. We need leave management, basic HR records, and an org chart.
manufacturing.q: Walk me through making one of your products: What raw materials go in, what comes out?
What machines or workstations are involved? Do they have capacity limits?

manufacturing.a: We can configure that during the implementation phase.
manufacturing.q: Is there a specific sequence of steps (routing) to make your products?

manufacturing.a: No strong preference, we are open to best practice recommendations.
manufacturing.q: Do you make to stock (in advance) or make to order (when customer orders)?

manufacturing.a: We are a manufacturing company called BelgiumParts NV, making precision metal components for the automotive industry. We have 95 employees across two sites in Ghent and Antwerp.
manufacturing.q: How do you track production time? Do workers clock in/out of jobs?

purchase.a: Accounting is in an old on-premise system. We need EUR as primary currency. 21% Belgian VAT. Fiscal year ends December 31.
purchase.q: How many suppliers do you regularly buy from? Do you have preferred vendors for specific products?

purchase.a: We invoice on delivery. About 300 invoices per month. Bank reconciliation is very manual.
purchase.q: Do purchase orders need approval? At what amount threshold?

purchase.a: We have bills of materials for about 120 product variants. Work centres are CNC milling, turning, and assembly. Production lead time is 3-5 days.
purchase.q: Do you negotiate pricing or contracts with suppliers in advance?

purchase.a: 6 main suppliers, all European. We want automatic reorder points and 3-quote comparison for orders above €5,000.
purchase.q: When goods arrive, what's your receiving process? Do you inspect quality?

sales.a: We invoice on delivery. About 300 invoices per month. Bank reconciliation is very manual.
sales.q: Walk me through your sales process: How does someone go from 'interested' to 'paying customer'?

sales.a: We have bills of materials for about 120 product variants. Work centres are CNC milling, turning, and assembly. Production lead time is 3-5 days.
sales.q: How do you price your products? Do you have standard prices, or does it vary by customer, quantity, or region?

sales.a: 6 main suppliers, all European. We want automatic reorder points and 3-quote comparison for orders above €5,000.
sales.q: Do your salespeople give discounts? If so, are there limits or do they need approval?

sales.a: 80 employees on payroll, 15 contractors. We need leave management, basic HR records, and an org chart.
sales.q: Do you send quotes/proposals to customers? What needs to be on them?
How do you track where leads come from? (Website, referrals, ads, trade shows, etc.)

mentioned_topics.payroll: 80 employees on payroll, 15 contractors. We need leave management, basic HR records, and an org char

scoping_responses.a: We are a manufacturing company called BelgiumParts NV, making precision metal components for the automotive industry. We have 95 employees across two sites in Ghent and Antwerp.
scoping_responses.q: What products or services do you sell, and how do customers typically buy from you? (e.g., 'B2B quotes via sales reps', 'online store', 'contracts and renewals')

scoping_responses.a: Our main pain points are: inventory tracking across two warehouses is done in Excel, production scheduling is manual, purchase orders are emailed manually to suppliers, and our accounting team spends 2 days per month reconciling spreadsheets. We also have no CRM — leads are tracked in a shared inbox.
scoping_responses.q: Do you handle physical goods — warehousing, shipping, or inventory tracking?

scoping_responses.a: A customer sends an RFQ, our sales team creates a quotation in Word, once confirmed they email manufacturing. Manufacturing creates a production order based on a bill of materials, we source raw materials from 6 main suppliers, produce the parts, do quality inspection, then ship via DHL freight. Invoicing is done on delivery. Payment terms are net-30.
scoping_responses.q: Do you manufacture, assemble, or transform raw materials into finished products?

scoping_responses.a: About 30 active users: 6 in sales, 4 in accounting, 3 managers, 14 on the factory floor, 3 warehouse staff.
scoping_responses.q: How do you handle purchasing from suppliers? Do you use purchase orders, blanket contracts, or something informal?

scoping_responses.a: We use a basic CRM spreadsheet for leads. Win rate is around 35%. Average deal size is €18,000.
scoping_responses.q: Do you track projects, timesheets, or bill clients on time & materials?

scoping_responses.a: Standard 30-day payment terms. We accept bank transfer and occasionally credit card for smaller orders.
scoping_responses.q: How do you handle invoicing and accounting today? Do you deal with multi-currency, multiple tax rates, or specific fiscal requirements?

scoping_responses.a: Two warehouses (Ghent and Antwerp). Tracked in Excel. Monthly manual counts. FIFO costing. Raw material lead time is 2-5 weeks from European suppliers.
scoping_responses.q: How many employees do you have? Do you need to manage leave requests, attendance, payroll, or expense claims in Odoo?

scoping_responses.a: Currently no reorder rules — we run out of stock roughly 4 times per year which causes production delays.
scoping_responses.q: Do you sell online or need a website? What platform are you using today, if any?

scoping_responses.a: Accounting is in an old on-premise system. We need EUR as primary currency. 21% Belgian VAT. Fiscal year ends December 31.
scoping_responses.q: What existing software or systems need to connect to Odoo? (e.g., Shopify, QuickBooks, Stripe, spreadsheets, custom APIs)

pain_points: Our main pain points are: inventory tracking across two warehouses is done in Excel, production scheduling is manual, purchase orders are emailed manually to suppliers, and our accounting team spends 2 days per month reconciling spreadsheets. We also have no CRM — leads are tracked in a shared inbox.
We use a basic CRM spreadsheet for leads. Win rate is around 35%. Average deal size is €18,000.
Two warehouses (Ghent and Antwerp). Tracked in Excel. Monthly manual counts. FIFO costing. Raw material lead time is 2-5 weeks from European suppliers.
We invoice on delivery. About 300 invoices per month. Bank reconciliation is very manual.

user_roles.description: Sales team member with CRM and quotation access
user_roles.name: Sales User

user_roles.description: Warehouse staff with stock and picking access
user_roles.name: Warehouse User
